pull_requests.title: BIP3: Rename Created to Assigned
pull_requests.body: Renames the “Created” header to “Assigned” to better reflect the meaning of the date held in this header field.

comment_list.body: Sorry for such a late join, but wouldn't "date of number assignment" be "numbered" rather than "assigned"?

> Sorry for such a late join, but wouldn't "date of number assignment" be "numbered" rather than "assigned"?

Thanks @katesalazar for the suggestion. Discussed your question with Murch offline, and I think the only clear improvement over "assigned" would be a phrase that includes the word “date”, e.g., assignment date, date of number assignment, etc.

For now, we'll leave it as-is, and it can be improved later, if desired (for instance, after #1820).

pull_requests.title: BIP324: Fix features bitmask for decoding-case selection
pull_requests.body: Replace (features & 4) with (features & 3) in the four decoding-case checks. The docstring specifies that the lower two bits (f & 3) select which of x1/x2/x3 are valid. Using (features & 4) limited the value to {0,4}, making cases 1 and 2 unreachable and bypassing proper gating when bit 4 (u >= p) was set. This aligns implementation with the documented behavior and ensures all four modes are exercised correctly.

comment_list.body: I think that change is correct, but then this PR will also need to update the pregenerated `packet_encoding_test_vectors.csv`.

> I think that change is correct, but then this PR will also need to update the pregenerated `packet_encoding_test_vectors.csv`.

See #2016
Ok, closing in favor of #2016 that cherry-picks this commit and then updates the generated files per https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1969#issuecomment-3318334945 above.
